a.title: RESERVE SCHOOLS VIRTUAL CONTINUOUS LEARNING
a.div:
School buildings will be closed for the remainder of the academic year. Virtual classes are in session.
High School Students: Your teachers will be in touch via Google Classroom and email. Check both frequently.
Elementary Parents: Please contact your child(ren)s teacher with any questions. (Teacher Contact Info on Parents Tab)
Please refer to newmexico.gov for the most up to date information on COVID-19.
Remember to wash your hands frequently!

div.span: STUDENT MEAL PICKUP NEW TIMES AND LOCATIONS

div.div:
TIMES HAVE CHANGED!
Reserve/Frisco Students @ School Pickup Lane: 10:30AM-11:00AM
Apache Creek Area Students @ Apache Creek Store Parking Lot: 10:15AM - 10:30AM
Aragon Area Students @ Catholic Church Parking Lot: 10:40AM-11:00AM
Alma Area Students @ Alma Store Parking Lot: 11:15AM-11:30AM
Pleasanton Area Students @ Pleasanton Bus Stop: 10:45AM-11:00AM
Luna Area Students @ LDS Church Parking Lot: 10:30AM-10:45AM

div.div: The Reserve School District is committed to Nurturing and Enhancing each student's opportunity to achieve necessary skills for becoming a productive member of society. Our mission is to provide a safe learning environment that is conducive to the development and enhancement of personal growth to all.

div.div: Reserve Independent School District conducts school board meetings the second Wednesday of every month at 6:00 PM in the conference room at the school.

div.p: We had a wonderful 55th Annual Mountaineer Invitational Basketball tournament and our varsity athletes would like to thank all of the trophy sponsors for their support!

span.data-emptytext: Reserve Independent Schools provides equal opportunity in its programs, activities, and employment
span.data-value: Reserve Independent Schools provides equal opportunity in its programs, activities, and employment

p.span: Reserve Independent Schools provides equal opportunity in its programs, activities, and employment

p.a: Website Hosting Solution Powered by SchoolBlocks

div.h3:
Welcome to the SchoolBlocks
self-guided tour!
div.p: The most common question we receive is, how is SchoolBlocks inspired by Pinterest? SchoolBlocks eliminates navigation bars and uses a block style layout that’s similar to Pinterest. It creates a unique and engaging browsing experience, optimizes for mobile and removes a lot of navigational complexity.
Please click on the red plus signs found on this page to learn more about specific features.
As an administrator, you will have the custom page editing tools auto-load. Just click ‘read more’ to access our advanced page editing tools.
This bar holds all content types. Click on the Admin button, click "add block", select a content type, add your content then insert the block into the page.
This icon appears when you have edit permissions. Hold your mouse down and move the block. You’ll see the page reorganize!
Each block type has a custom editing experience. Click the pencil on any block or view our help documentation to learn more about block types.
